metadata.title: CVE-2023-5870 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL involving the pg_cancel_backend role thatsignals background workers, including the logical replication launcher,autovacuum workers, and the autovacuum launcher. Successful exploitationrequires a non-core extension with a less-resilient background worker andwould affect that specific background worker only. This issue may allow aremote high privileged user to launch a denial of service (DoS) attack.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3 package in trusty is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-08-23').
postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
